paper_abstract: Although cloud computing environments often use virtualization to implement resource sharing, the added hypervisor layer between virtual machines (VMs) and hardware resources creates performance overhead. Measuring virtualization performance is thus crucial for running applications efficiently and further improving VM techniques. To address the insufficiencies of existing benchmarking methods, the proposed three-layer strategy fully evaluates VM system performance and includes both a benchmark suite to measure various virtualization scenarios and an automated performance testing toolkit.
paper_title: Virt-B: Toward Performance Benchmarking of Virtual Machine Systems
